title: Geospatial and Data Services: Libraries - Northwestern University
content: The geospatial and data services team helps Northwestern researchers and students find, analyze, visualize and learn about data. Meet one-on-one with a data specialist from the library or NUIT. Request a consult Invite us to your class to teach your students GIS and data skills. Teach with us We offer free workshops and training opportunities throughout the year to help you develop your data skills, focused mainly on GIS and qualitative data analysis. Our colleagues in NUIT's Research Computing Services also host a series of data science workshops.  Kelsey Rydland Team Lead, Geospatial and Data Service kelsey.rydland@northwestern.edu Skills: GIS, map making, GIS data, quantitative analysis  MÃ©ch Frazier GIS Specialist mech.frazier@northwestern.edu Skills: ArcPro, ArcOnline, QGIS, Google Earth Engine, Python (Arcpy), R  Sarah Thorngate Data Analysis Librarian sarah.thorngate@northwestern.edu Make an appointment Skills: SPSS, NVIVO, Dedoose, Python, R, HTML, CSS The Geospatial and Data Visualization Lab is located in Mudd 2122. It is equipped with four high-performance PCs for geospatial and data visualization work. Research Computing Services Data Science Initiative Digital Humanities
